definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: He left off hellos waistcoat as soon as he came into the room.
sentences.chinese: 一件淡蓝色马甲的袖管只垂到了她的臂弯处。

sentences.english: His elbow was poking through his torn shirt sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 他的肘伸出了撕破的衬衣袖管。

sentences.english: I had taken off the stars, but that was for convenience.
sentences.chinese: 我已把袖管上的星章割掉，那只是为了便利起见。

sentences.english: Bosses have to roll up their sleeves and work.
sentences.chinese: 老板得卷起袖管亲历亲为。

sentences.english: He had a full seidel of beer in his right hand and his empty left sleeve was flapping.
sentences.chinese: 他的右手拿着一整杯啤酒，空荡荡的左袖管扑扇着。

sentences.english: The sleeves of a pale blue waistcoat came only to her elbows.
sentences.chinese: 一件淡蓝色马甲的袖管只垂到了她的臂弯处。

definition: the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
corner of the lower hem of a jacket etc
